info.title: Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-site-cfg
info.description:
Model for managing site configurations
     Copyright (c) 2016-2023, 2025 by Cisco Systems, Inc.
     All rights reserved.

**Configuration Module**
**Module:** `Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-site-cfg`
**Paths:** 36

**📊 YANG Tree:** [View Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-site-cfg structure](https://jeremycohoe.github.io/cisco-ios-xe-openapi-swagger/yang-trees/Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-site-cfg.html)

beacon-id.description: BLE ibeacon ID for which global BLE configurations to be applied.

txpower.description: TX power of particular ibeacon for HALO enabled APs that have joined the controller.The TX power is based on size of proximity zone needed.

enabled.description: The status of the BLE beacons. enable(1) - enable the BLE beacon disable(2) - disable the BLE beacon.

uuid.description: The UUID (universally unique identifier) which is a 128-bit value

up-to-dscp.description: AP upstream traffic User Priority to DSCP mapping

dscp.description: DSCP to be mapped to User Priority

profile-name.description: Priming profile name of the AP

description.description: Description of the Site Tag

ble-beacon-interval.description: The BLE beacon interval for the AP

data-encryption-flag.description: The data encryption status of AP

ap-trace-profile.description: AP trace profile name applied on the AP

bssid-enable-stats.description: Flag to enable BSSID stats on AP

bssid-stats-frequency.description: Time frequency on AP to send BSSID stats

private-ip-discovery.description: Discovery Response from private IP is enabled or disabled

public-ip-discovery.description: Discovery Response from public IP is enabled or disabled

bssid-neighbor-stats-enable.description: Flag to enable BSSID neighbor statistics on AP

bssid-neighbor-stats-frequency.description:
Time interval between consecutive BSSID neighbor stats update send by the AP.The permissible range is updated from 1..180 to 30..600 and default value is updated from 30 to 180 to prevent high CPU utilization due to processing of
         multiple BSSID neighbor reports per sec

stats-timer.description: This object specifies the stats timer for the AP

led-state.description: The LED state of all the access points should be enabled or disabled.

jumbo-mtu.description: True if jumbo mtu is enabled for the AP

ap-mode.description: Mode of operation of the AP

login-credentials.description: The Global AP 802.1x Supplicant Authentication login credentials

lsc-ap-auth-type-info.description: Global AP 802.1x LSC AP auth type info

backup-controllers.description: Backup controller configuration for the AP

lag-info.description: The AP-lag status of all the access points in the profile whether enabled or disabled.

traffic-limit.description: The maximum dot1x session limit for the AP

cdp.description: True, if cdp is enabled for the AP

capwap-window.description: CAPWAP transport window size for the AP

reporting-interval.description: Interval at which AP should send client stats

persistent-ssid-broadcast.description: True if persistent SSID broadcast is enabled on the AP

usb-module-status.description: Status of USB configuration if disabled/enabled

beacon-id.description: BLE ibeacon ID for which global BLE configurations to be applied.

txpower.description: TX power of particular ibeacon for HALO enabled APs that have joined the controller.The TX power is based on size of proximity zone needed.

enabled.description: The status of the BLE beacons. enable(1) - enable the BLE beacon disable(2) - disable the BLE beacon.

uuid.description: The UUID (universally unique identifier) which is a 128-bit value

icap-full-packet-trace-client-mac-addres.description: Selects the clients for which to collect traces, by client MAC address.

icap-partial-packet-trace-client-mac-add.description: Selects the clients for which to collect traces, by client MAC address.

icap-anomaly-detection-client-mac-addres.description: Selects the clients for which to collect traces, by client MAC address.

icap-client-statistics-client-mac-addres.description: Selects the clients for which to collect statistics, by client MAC address.

gas-rate-limit.description: Contains GAS rate limiting related configurations

up-to-dscp.description: AP upstream traffic User Priority to DSCP mapping

qosmap-dscp-to-ups.description: QoS Map - DSCP tp UP (User Priority) mapping ranges

dscp.description: DSCP to be mapped to User Priority

qosmap-dscp-to-up-exceptions.description: QoS Map - DSCP tp UP (User Priority) mapping exceptions

client-rssi.description: Configuration of Client RSSI statistics reporting

ntp-server-info.description: NTP server information to be used by AP

led-flash.description: LED flash mode and timer configuration of all the access points

dhcp-fallback.description: Allow AP to fallback to DHCP if it can not join controller via Static IP

antenna-monitor.description: Per AP profile antenna monitoring configuration

stats-monitor.description: Per AP profile ap stats configuration

ap-dtls-config.description: Per AP profile AP DTLS configuration

ap-country.description: Per AP profile AP country configuration

radio-stats-monitor.description: Per AP profile AP radio statistics monitoring configuration

ap-sensor-cfgs.description: Configure AP sensor attributes, by sensor type

ap-prof-pp-cfg.description: Power profile configuration per AP profile

client-limit.description: Maximum client limit per AP configuration

calendar-cfgs.description: Calendar profiles configuration for AP profile

icap-client-exclude-cfgs.description: Selects the WLAN profile for which telemetry data to be filtered out

kernel-coredump.description: AP kernel core dump related configurations

nsi-ports-cfg.description: AP network spectrum interface ports related configurations

aggregation.description: CAPWAP message aggregation configuration on controller

rlan-cfg.description: AP profile RLAN fast switching configurations

buffer-size.description: The size of the buffer Access Point should use to copy the captured packets for client and dump it to the FTP server. Default value is 2048 kilobytes

duration.description: Duration for which the Access Point should capture packets for specified client. Default value is 10

truncate-len.description: Length of the packet after truncation while capturing packets on the Access Point. Default value is 0 which indicates captured packet should contain the full payload length

ftp-server-ip.description: The IP Address of the FTP server. Access Point will dump the captured packets to a file in this ftp server

ftp-path.description: The directory path in the ftp server for storing the file which contains the captured packets in the Access Point.

ftp-username.description: The username to login into the ftp server in order to transfer the captured packets from the Access Point.

ftp-password.description: The password to login into the ftp server in order to transfer the captured packets from the Access Point.

ftp-password-type.description: This object specifies the password type to login into the ftp server in order to transfer the captured packets from the Access Point.

classifier-control.description: The filters for 802.11 control packets, while capturing packets on the Access Point. A value of 'true' indicates 802.11 control packets should be captured. A value of 'false' indicates 802.11 control packets should not be captured. Default value is true

classifier-management.description: The filters for 802.11 Management packets, while capturing packets on the Access Point. A value of 'true' indicates 802.11 Management packets should be captured. A value of 'false' indicates 802.11 Management packets should not be captured. Default value is true

classifier-data.description: The filters for 802.11 Data packets, while capturing packets on the Access Point. A value of 'true' indicates 802.11 Data packets should be captured. A value of 'false' indicates 802.11 Data packets should not be captured. Default value is false

classifier-dot1x.description: The filters for 802.11 Dot1x packets, while capturing packets on the Access Point. A value of 'true' indicates 802.11 Dot1x packets should be captured. A value of 'false' indicates 802.11 Dot1x packets should not be captured. Default value is false

classifier-arp.description: The filters for ARP packets while capturing packets on the Access Point. A value of 'true' indicates ARP packets should be captured. A value of 'false' indicates ARP packets should not be captured.Default value is false

classifier-iapp.description: The filters for 802.11 IAPP packets, while capturing packets on the Access Point. A value of 'true' indicates IAPP packets should be captured. A value of 'false' indicates IAPP packets should not be captured. Default value is false

classifier-ip.description: The filters for IP packets, while capturing packets on the Access Point. A value of ' true' indicates IP packets should be captured. A value of false' indicates IP packets should not be captured. Default value is false

classifier-tcp.description: The filters for TCP packets while capturing packets on the Access Point. Value of 'true' indicates IP packets should be captured. Value of 'false' indicates IP packets should not be captured. Default value is false

classifier-tcp-port.description: The filters for TCP packets, while capturing packets on the Access Point Value of 'true' indicates IP packets should be captured. Value of 'false' indicates IP packets should not be captured. Default value is false

classifier-udp.description: The filters for TCP packets, while capturing packets on the Access Point. Value of 'true' indicates IP packets should be captured. Value of 'false' indicates IP packets should not be captured. Default value is fals

classifier-udp-port.description: The filter value port number for UDP packets, while capturing packets on the Access Point. Default value is 0 which indicates all UDP packets should be captured

classifier-broadcast.description: The filters for 802.11 Broadcast packets, while capturing packets on the Access Point. A value of 'true' indicates Broadcast packets should be captured.A value of 'false' indicates Broadcast packets should not be captured. Default value is false

classifier-multicast.description: The filters for 802.11 Multicast packets, while capturing packets on the Access Point. A value of 'true' indicates Multicast packets should be captured. A value of 'false' indicates Multicast packets should not be captured. Default value is false

ap-trace-client-console-log.description: Flag to enable console logs at the AP

ap-trace-client-filter-arp.description: Trace filter to enable client's ARP packets tracing at the AP

ap-trace-client-filter-assoc.description: Trace filter to enable client's association packets tracing at the AP

ap-trace-client-filter-auth.description: Trace filter to enable client's authentication packets at the AP

ap-trace-client-filter-dhcp.description: Trace filter to enable client's DHCP packets tracing at the AP

ap-trace-client-filter-eap.description: Trace filter to enable client's EAP packets tracing at the AP

ap-trace-client-filter-icmp.description: Trace filter to enable client's ICMP packets tracing at the AP

ap-trace-client-filter-ndp.description: Trace filter to enable client's NDP packets tracing at the AP

ap-trace-client-filter-probe.description: Trace filter to enable client's probe packets tracing at the AP

override-existing-priming.description: Override current AP priming with priming profile

primary-wlc-name.description: Primary WLC name configuration of the AP

primary-wlc-ip.description: Primary WLC IP configuration of the AP

secondary-wlc-name.description: Secondary WLC name configuration of the AP

secondary-wlc-ip.description: Secondary WLC IP configuration of the AP

tertiary-wlc-name.description: Tertiary WLC name configuration of the AP

tertiary-wlc-ip.description: Tertiary WLC IP configuration of the AP

height.description: AP AGL (Above Ground Level) height in meters in range -100..1000

height-uncertainty.description: AP height uncertainty in meters in range 1..100

site-tag-name.description: Each entry represents a conceptual row in cLSiteTagConfigTable and corresponds to an Site Tag in a Elastic Wireless Controller.

flex-profile.description: The flex profile which is part of the Site tag

ap-join-profile.description: The Ap Join profile which is part of the Site tag

is-local-site.description: This parameter is set to enable local site

arp-caching.description: Enable or disable AP ARP caching

dhcp-bcast.description: Enable or disable fabric AP DHCP broadcast

load.description: Estimate of the relative load contributed by the site. AP count can be used as an approximation.

txpower.description: TX power of particular ibeacon for HALO enabled APs that have joined the controller.The TX power is based on size of proximity zone needed.

reporting-interval.description: Interval at which AP should send client stats

persistent-ssid-broadcast.description: True if persistent SSID broadcast is enabled on the AP

usb-module-status.description: Status of USB configuration if disabled/enabled

beacon-id.description: BLE ibeacon ID for which global BLE configurations to be applied.

txpower.description: TX power of particular ibeacon for HALO enabled APs that have joined the controller.The TX power is based on size of proximity zone needed.

enabled.description: The status of the BLE beacons. enable(1) - enable the BLE beacon disable(2) - disable the BLE beacon.

uuid.description: The UUID (universally unique identifier) which is a 128-bit value

icap-full-packet-trace-client-mac-addres.description: Selects the clients for which to collect traces, by client MAC address.

icap-partial-packet-trace-client-mac-add.description: Selects the clients for which to collect traces, by client MAC address.

icap-anomaly-detection-client-mac-addres.description: Selects the clients for which to collect traces, by client MAC address.

icap-client-statistics-client-mac-addres.description: Selects the clients for which to collect statistics, by client MAC address.

gas-rate-limit.description: Contains GAS rate limiting related configurations

up-to-dscp.description: AP upstream traffic User Priority to DSCP mapping

qosmap-dscp-to-ups.description: QoS Map - DSCP tp UP (User Priority) mapping ranges

dscp.description: DSCP to be mapped to User Priority

qosmap-dscp-to-up-exceptions.description: QoS Map - DSCP tp UP (User Priority) mapping exceptions

client-rssi.description: Configuration of Client RSSI statistics reporting

ntp-server-info.description: NTP server information to be used by AP

led-flash.description: LED flash mode and timer configuration of all the access points

dhcp-fallback.description: Allow AP to fallback to DHCP if it can not join controller via Static IP

antenna-monitor.description: Per AP profile antenna monitoring configuration

stats-monitor.description: Per AP profile ap stats configuration

ap-dtls-config.description: Per AP profile AP DTLS configuration

ap-country.description: Per AP profile AP country configuration

radio-stats-monitor.description: Per AP profile AP radio statistics monitoring configuration

ap-sensor-cfgs.description: Configure AP sensor attributes, by sensor type

ap-prof-pp-cfg.description: Power profile configuration per AP profile

client-limit.description: Maximum client limit per AP configuration

calendar-cfgs.description: Calendar profiles configuration for AP profile

icap-client-exclude-cfgs.description: Selects the WLAN profile for which telemetry data to be filtered out

kernel-coredump.description: AP kernel core dump related configurations

nsi-ports-cfg.description: AP network spectrum interface ports related configurations

aggregation.description: CAPWAP message aggregation configuration on controller

rlan-cfg.description: AP profile RLAN fast switching configurations

txpower.description: TX power of particular ibeacon for HALO enabled APs that have joined the controller.The TX power is based on size of proximity zone needed.

enabled.description: The status of the BLE beacons. enable(1) - enable the BLE beacon disable(2) - disable the BLE beacon.

uuid.description: The UUID (universally unique identifier) which is a 128-bit value

description.description: Description for the ap configuration profile

ble-beacon-interval.description: The BLE beacon interval for the AP

data-encryption-flag.description: The data encryption status of AP

ap-trace-profile.description: AP trace profile name applied on the AP

bssid-enable-stats.description: Flag to enable BSSID stats on AP

bssid-stats-frequency.description: Time frequency on AP to send BSSID stats

private-ip-discovery.description: Discovery Response from private IP is enabled or disabled

public-ip-discovery.description: Discovery Response from public IP is enabled or disabled

bssid-neighbor-stats-enable.description: Flag to enable BSSID neighbor statistics on AP

bssid-neighbor-stats-frequency.description:
Time interval between consecutive BSSID neighbor stats update send by the AP.The permissible range is updated from 1..180 to 30..600 and default value is updated from 30 to 180 to prevent high CPU utilization due to processing of
         multiple BSSID neighbor reports per sec

stats-timer.description: This object specifies the stats timer for the AP

led-state.description: The LED state of all the access points should be enabled or disabled.

jumbo-mtu.description: True if jumbo mtu is enabled for the AP

ap-mode.description: Mode of operation of the AP

login-credentials.description: The Global AP 802.1x Supplicant Authentication login credentials

lsc-ap-auth-type-info.description: Global AP 802.1x LSC AP auth type info

backup-controllers.description: Backup controller configuration for the AP

lag-info.description: The AP-lag status of all the access points in the profile whether enabled or disabled.

traffic-limit.description: The maximum dot1x session limit for the AP

profile-name.description: The profile name of the packet capture profile

description.description: Description of the packet capture profile

buffer-size.description: The size of the buffer Access Point should use to copy the captured packets for client and dump it to the FTP server. Default value is 2048 kilobytes

duration.description: Duration for which the Access Point should capture packets for specified client. Default value is 10

truncate-len.description: Length of the packet after truncation while capturing packets on the Access Point. Default value is 0 which indicates captured packet should contain the full payload length

ftp-server-ip.description: The IP Address of the FTP server. Access Point will dump the captured packets to a file in this ftp server

ftp-path.description: The directory path in the ftp server for storing the file which contains the captured packets in the Access Point.

ftp-username.description: The username to login into the ftp server in order to transfer the captured packets from the Access Point.

ftp-password.description: The password to login into the ftp server in order to transfer the captured packets from the Access Point.

ftp-password-type.description: This object specifies the password type to login into the ftp server in order to transfer the captured packets from the Access Point.

classifier-control.description: The filters for 802.11 control packets, while capturing packets on the Access Point. A value of 'true' indicates 802.11 control packets should be captured. A value of 'false' indicates 802.11 control packets should not be captured. Default value is true

classifier-management.description: The filters for 802.11 Management packets, while capturing packets on the Access Point. A value of 'true' indicates 802.11 Management packets should be captured. A value of 'false' indicates 802.11 Management packets should not be captured. Default value is true

classifier-data.description: The filters for 802.11 Data packets, while capturing packets on the Access Point. A value of 'true' indicates 802.11 Data packets should be captured. A value of 'false' indicates 802.11 Data packets should not be captured. Default value is false

classifier-dot1x.description: The filters for 802.11 Dot1x packets, while capturing packets on the Access Point. A value of 'true' indicates 802.11 Dot1x packets should be captured. A value of 'false' indicates 802.11 Dot1x packets should not be captured. Default value is false

classifier-arp.description: The filters for ARP packets while capturing packets on the Access Point. A value of 'true' indicates ARP packets should be captured. A value of 'false' indicates ARP packets should not be captured.Default value is false

classifier-iapp.description: The filters for 802.11 IAPP packets, while capturing packets on the Access Point. A value of 'true' indicates IAPP packets should be captured. A value of 'false' indicates IAPP packets should not be captured. Default value is false

classifier-ip.description: The filters for IP packets, while capturing packets on the Access Point. A value of ' true' indicates IP packets should be captured. A value of false' indicates IP packets should not be captured. Default value is false

classifier-tcp.description: The filters for TCP packets while capturing packets on the Access Point. Value of 'true' indicates IP packets should be captured. Value of 'false' indicates IP packets should not be captured. Default value is false

classifier-tcp-port.description: The filters for TCP packets, while capturing packets on the Access Point Value of 'true' indicates IP packets should be captured. Value of 'false' indicates IP packets should not be captured. Default value is false

classifier-udp.description: The filters for TCP packets, while capturing packets on the Access Point. Value of 'true' indicates IP packets should be captured. Value of 'false' indicates IP packets should not be captured. Default value is fals

classifier-udp-port.description: The filter value port number for UDP packets, while capturing packets on the Access Point. Default value is 0 which indicates all UDP packets should be captured

classifier-broadcast.description: The filters for 802.11 Broadcast packets, while capturing packets on the Access Point. A value of 'true' indicates Broadcast packets should be captured.A value of 'false' indicates Broadcast packets should not be captured. Default value is false

classifier-multicast.description: The filters for 802.11 Multicast packets, while capturing packets on the Access Point. A value of 'true' indicates Multicast packets should be captured. A value of 'false' indicates Multicast packets should not be captured. Default value is false

site-tag-name.description: Each entry represents a conceptual row in cLSiteTagConfigTable and corresponds to an Site Tag in a Elastic Wireless Controller.

description.description: Description of the Site Tag

flex-profile.description: The flex profile which is part of the Site tag

ap-join-profile.description: The Ap Join profile which is part of the Site tag

is-local-site.description: This parameter is set to enable local site

arp-caching.description: Enable or disable AP ARP caching

dhcp-bcast.description: Enable or disable fabric AP DHCP broadcast

load.description: Estimate of the relative load contributed by the site. AP count can be used as an approximation.
